basics.name: Michael Alonge
basics.label: Software Engineer & Computational Biologist
basics.summary: Experienced professional with expertise in [your field]. Passionate about [key interests] and committed to delivering [value proposition].

work.name: Ohalo Genetics
work.summary: I lead the design and development of the genomics data platform for Ohalo Genetics responsible for automated and scalable management and analysis of genomics data supporting breeding, gene editing, and scientific IP. I also serve as the lead subject matter expert for genomics and bioinformatics with an emphasis on scalable and accurate genotyping methods.
highlights: Lead the development of the genomics data platform for Ohalo Genetics
Manage and mentor a team of software engineers and bioinformaticians
Lead the strategic direction of genomics supporting gene editing, breeding, and IP

work.name: Ohalo Genetics
work.summary: Brief description of role and company
highlights: Lead bioinformatics and genomics analysis for Ohalo's Boosted Breeding™ foundational patents.
Developed Ohalo's first scalable genotyping pipeline supporting breeding and gene editing.
Lead bioinformatics and genomics analysis for all programs, like Ohalo's 'FruitionOne' Almond program.

work.name: Johns Hopkins University
work.summary: I completed my Ph.D. in Computer Science at Johns Hopkins University under the supervision of Professor Michael Schatz. My research focused on advanced applications of genome assembly and structural genetic variation in both humans and plants. I served as a teaching assistant for 'Computational Genomics: Sequences', taught by Professor Ben Langmead.
highlights: Published several first author papers in journals such as Cell and Science
Inited speaker at a Galaxy webinar and the Boyce Thompson Institute for Plant Research

work.name: Driscoll's
work.position: Research Associate I and II: Computational Biology
work.summary: I led computational biology projects with the ultimate goal of assisting breeders and molecular biologists. I especially focused on establishing reference genome assemblies to facilitate downstream genomics analyses. I also assisted with wet-lab protocols and plant phenotyping.
highlights: Led computational biology projects with the ultimate goal of assisting breeders and molecular biologists
Established reference genome assemblies to facilitate downstream genomics analyses
Assisted with wet-lab protocols and plant phenotyping
